timeline.bodyText: do we not need the try/catch block anymore?
timeline.author: ananvay

replies.bodyText: All runners now support the pull protocol.
replies.author: robertwb

timeline.bodyText: Is this too large of a time interval? I'm assuming the SDK would ideally not wait ~10 min before starting the bundle, right?
timeline.author: ananvay
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -206,18 +205,16 @@ public static void main(
 
       LoadingCache<String, BeamFnApi.ProcessBundleDescriptor> processBundleDescriptors =
           CacheBuilder.newBuilder()
+              .maximumSize(1000)
+              .expireAfterAccess(10, TimeUnit.MINUTES)

replies.bodyText: This is the time duration between never seeing a bundle of this type and discarding its description from the cache. It could be smaller, but I figured it was good to start out very conservatively (both count and time).
replies.author: robertwb

timeline.message:
[BEAM-9730] Ignore bundle registration requests.

Instead always pull bundle descriptors from the runner.

This avoids having potentially duplicated caches of all bundle
descriptors.
Bound the size of the process bundle descriptor cache.
Bound the size of the process bundle descriptor cache.
